message.body: hello Jess?
Hi Andres
good monday morning
Good Morning, how are you doing?
I'm good. off to a good start so far. How about you?
I'm pretty good, I may have to go to NY this afternoon though, which is never a fun commute
oh my. job interview?
yeah, it would be a second interview. I'm just waiting to here back from them
hear*
what are you up to today?
Im in the office working on some reports. Its pretty dead in here at the moment. So you think you have a good shot at this job?
I'm not really sure, I didn't think the first interview went that great, so I'm surprised they're calling me back in
well it's worth a try. Do you drive up there?
Yeah, I'll drive and take the train in. The place is actually in Brooklyn so it takes a bit longer
I've had seven interviews in NY, so I'm a pro at commuting there by now
How do like it up there?
I like it, it's a fun place to be I just wish the cost of living was much lower
which do you prefer, NY or LA?
definitely NY, that's probably b/c its more familiar to me. how about you?
same here. I haven't been to NY in a while, but I didnt care much for LA when I was there
and the fact that NY is much closer helps
right, LA can feel really superficial
the areas surrounding LA where cool. I went to santa monica and santa barbara and liked it, but LA was just a pain
i agree, I spent some time in Venice which I loved
I didn't go to San Diego but hear its great
san diego is fun, much less of a pain to drive around in than LA
I'll bet. If you're going to live in a city like that, there
is usually no point in having a car
I think the person who asked me to come in for an interview today forgot that I live in delaware
not surprising, probably forgot anyone lives in DE :/
haha, it's funny whenever I go to NY for an interview and i sit down they look at my address with such surprise, like they hadn't looked at my resume before
Im sure they don't expect to see that. Most people probably live in NY or NJ
yeah, they then seem apologetic that I drove all that way
it's not really that bad, unless there's traffic
it isn't a bad drive, but it can be if they call me in with little time to get there
well they need to give you sufficient notice, you don't want to have to rush
yeah, that's the frustrating thing. this company I'm waiting to hear from wanted someone to start this week
oh...
that could be tricky. Are you considering the position?
err, that is to say have they implied any offer?

well it sounds promising if they want to meet with me again, it really all depends what they would pay me. pretty often i've been interviewing with places and they just don't pay enough for what the job requires
true, and if it's in NY then that would need to be considered as well
though generally that is reflected in the pay
my stepdad used to work in NY and he said that half of his paycheck would be taken out in taxes
which is why i didn't want to get a job there
Was he living in NJ at the time?
no, he lived in ny
it's probably a little better if you don't live in the city, but NJ has very high taxes as well. My dad lives in Jersey
oh yeah, that's why my parents left NJ, the taxes were outrageous
thats one thing I do like about DE
i agree, that is a plus
So where in DE are you staying?
Middletown
Oh, that makes a difference
You're south of the canal as we say
haha, i haven't heard that before
how about "slower lower"
i have not heard that, i suppose if i were from here that would be familiar
i have noticed a big difference between the northern and southern parts of this state
it's true. People that aren't familiar with DE don't seem to understand it's almost like 2 totally different places.
I'm pretty familiar with middletown. I've done some work down there
oh, ok. it's definitely a sleepy town
i need to get going, it was nice chatting with you
